intro: Youngia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered youngia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its elongated, yellowish flower heads that bloom in late summer. Youngia longiflora is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
